item.title: Dead tree branch overhanging road., 21st August
item.description:
I've not done a great job of identifying the location. There are approx two large trees on this side of the road. One has a huge dead branch about to snap off from the canopy. It would be big enough to cause serious injury to a driver or pedestrian beneath.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chargrove Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Incredibly loud, loose manhole on busy road by houses, 21st August
item.description:
Has been an issue for months and with windows open at night causes sleep disturbances. Surely unsafe to drive on!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 103, Hucclecote Road, Hucclecote, Gloucester

item.title: Road marking lane missing, 21st August
item.description:
After roadworks done on 20/08/2024 there is no do not park Lane painted by the no 8 and 10 driveway. Could You please advise company to put that lane just like they did on no 6. That will prevent blocking those driveways by cars parking on the street.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Kingsmead Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Tree is encroaching on road (Brandon Terrace Lane), 21st August
item.description:
A sycamore (?) tree (fast growing) in a back lane. It will soon be making the lane difficult for service vehicles (bin lorries, for example) to access. It is on the west side of the lane across from the rear of 15 Gratton Road (NB there is no 13 Gratton Road).
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brandon Terrace Lane, Tivoli, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Tree causing damage/obstruction to pavement or road

item.title: The entirety of Queen’s road is dangerous for pedestrians, 21st August
item.description:
All you need to do is send someone out to walk from the Lansdown to the station on either side of the road and it’s unbelievably clear how dangerous the pavements are. I frequently see people trip on the road, have seen an elderly woman fall and have to be helped, have tripped myself including twice this morning (on different sides of the road!), and last year in fact fractured my elbow as well as losing two fingernails due to falling, caused the the irregularities in the pavement on the way from the station to Tivoli. I don’t know why you’ve not attempted to fix these issues for the 3 years I’ve lived here, but it’s time a project was undertaken to make it safe. I would never want to see the trees cut down and understand the pavement will not be perfectly level, but it must become less of a hazard to those of us using it. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 43, Queen's Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Several large potholes, 21st August
item.description:
There are several large potholes and damage to the road surface on the westbound stretch of Lobleys Drive approaching the bridge over the M5. These have been getting worse over a period of several months and likely to cause damage to suspension and tyres.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned lorry and large trailer, 20th August
item.description:
In the layby are 2 vehicles that haven't moved for the last 4 months but instead I belive have been abandoned, both vehicles are white but one is a lorry and one is a lorry trailer. Please can these be looked into as they look as if they they will be vandalised or arsoned soon. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Andoversford, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
